revised_title: Discussion on Glass Thermometers and Temperature Measurement
tldr: The author discusses the limitations of using glass thermometers for temperature measurement and the importance of consistent treatment. They also mention the Tonnelot thermometer as an intermediate standard and highlight the need for further research on the stability of irreversible hydrosols. The paper also presents various other scientific contributions, including mathematical contributions to evolution and the periodicity in the electric touch of chemical elements.
